Class DeleteScout

  • java.lang.Object
    • DeleteScout

  • public class DeleteScout
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the screen where the user deletes a scout from the database. All the scouts in the database are displayed in two columns. Each scout can be selected then the user is prompted to confirm whether scout should be deleted. The system will then remove scout from the database and delete the table for that scout.
    Author:
    Matthew Brookes

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DeleteScout(javax.swing.JFrame frame)
      The class' only constructor has a JFrame as an argument which is passed from the home screen.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DeleteScout

        public DeleteScout(javax.swing.JFrame frame)
        The class' only constructor has a JFrame as an argument which is passed from the home screen. On this frame the scout names are displayed then the pop-up is displayed. The back button will be directed towards the Scout Management screen.
        Parameters:
        frame - The screen where buttons will be drawn

    • Method Detail

      • drawScreen

        private static void drawScreen(javax.swing.JFrame frame)
        This function draws the first screen the user sees when this section is started. It consists of the names of all scouts in the database in two columns which are ordered by firstname. The user is then prompted whether to delete scout.
        Parameters:
        frame - The screen of the program
